title: [Self-Directed] Artificial Neural Network-Based Optical Encoder Design and Application

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational machine learning concepts, optical sensor principles, and linear algebra
context.additional_context: A lifelong education program for working professionals, focusing on case-based learning applicable to real-world industrial settings.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of converting phase-shift data from optical encoders into input vectors for artificial neural networks.
Learners can design a multilayer neural network model with backpropagation algorithms and train it to achieve angle measurement errors within 10°.
Learners can propose a hybrid data preprocessing methodology to maintain measurement accuracy across the full 360° angular range.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
